feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 18 at 7:16PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...MENDENHALL LAKE AND RIVER LEVELS REMAIN HIGH... Water levels along the Mendenhall Lake and Mendenhall River in Juneau continue to slowly rise due to heavy rainfall earlier in the week. Lake levels are expected to crest by mid morning just below 9 feet, and a slow fall is expected through the day on Friday as no additional precipitation is forecast for the area.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Juneau Borough and Northern Admiralty Island

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 18 at 4:07PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...PERIODS OF RAINFALL WILL CONTINUE ACROSS SOUTHCENTRAL THROUGH SATURDAY... An upper low slowly moving into Southcentral continues to pump Gulf moisture into the region with numerous showers lifting into the Anchorage Bowl. As the low makes further eastward progress, southwest flow ahead of the low, and up Cook Inlet, will bring
entry.cap:areaDesc: Anchorage

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 18 at 1:46PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Rising Water Levels on Rivers Draining the Brooks Range... Several weather fronts moving across the eastern Brooks Range will bring rising water levels to rivers and streams. Additional rainfall totals from 0.50 to 1.00 inches are possible through Friday. Some isolated locations could see higher amounts. Water levels are expected to remain within bank and below flood stage.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Northeastern Brooks Range

entry.title: High Surf Advisory issued August 18 at 10:57PM SST by NWS
entry.summary: ...A High Surf Advisory remains in effect... * WHAT...Surf of 12 to 15 feet. * WHERE...South and east facing shores of all islands. * WHEN...through Friday. * IMPACTS...Minor. Expect some strong breaking waves, shorebreak, and strong longshore and rip currents making swimming difficult
entry.cap:areaDesc: Manua; Swains Island; Tutuila and Aunuu
